column5: I’m thinking about putting tracks on my boat.  Two 24”.  Looks like the parts are hard to get.   	what brand are people using?  	Terry any thoughts?
I guess I need mounts for my downeasters x2.  Downriggersx2.  Tube rod holdersx2.

I had 24 inch on my Lund they are great because I had 3 different types of rod holders that all fit in the tracks. I just bought the cheapest I could find at the time that was comparable with the most makes of mounts    Brian made a couple of mounts for me to save even more money traxstech was the make I had

I keep waffling on it.  Thing’s have changed since this morning.  Now I might not Downrigger out of my boat any more this year.  Earliest I’d need them is next summer.  By then I might have a different boat. Lol.
Cannons are usually easiest to find, but at the end of the day they are all pretty much the same and I'd buy what's cheapest and available.
The cannon track isn't cheap but it seems sturdy. I got mine from Grimsby Tackle.. Bills bait in Hamilton may also have some..
Grimsby Tackle has good stock of tracks & rod holders from Cannon & Custom Fishing Solutions.  Also all the other parts/accessories/materials plus the guidance to complete the instal.
